alert.note: Alert for Humboldt (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 13 at 9:52PM PST until January 14 at 3:00PM PST by NWS Eureka
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Eureka has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in California... Redwood Creek At Orick affecting Humboldt County. .The Redwood Creek is near historic levels and is forecast to rise perilously close to flood stage Saturday night into Sunday morning. Stay alert for the latest river forecasts. For the Redwood Creek...including Orick...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Redwood Creek at Orick. * WHEN...From Saturday evening to Sunday afternoon. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:15 PM PST Saturday the stage was 29.9 feet and is forecast to crest near 31 feet. - Bankfull stage is 32.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:15 PM PST Saturday was 30.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 31.0 feet late this evening. - Action stage is 26.0 feet. - Flood stage is 32.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (10 pm PST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sun Mon Tue Redwood Creek Orick 32.0 29.9 Sat 9 pm PST 21.1 17.0 16.7 &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Additional information is available at weather.gov/eka. The next statement will be issued Sunday morning.Sunday morning at 1000 AM PST.
